medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient reports constant dull RUQ pain starting in her right flank and radiating to RUQ, which worsens with eating and lasts for hours after meals. Pain severely worsened at 4 AM this morning. She has had associated nausea without vomiting. After discharge from a recent admission, right-sided pain returned, prompting return to the ED for reevaluation. She has worsened pain but noted some improvement with medication.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Past medical history notable for hypertension (HTN), hyperlipidemia (HLD), Bell's palsy, right upper quadrant (RUQ) pain due to choledocholithiasis with post-ERCP pancreatitis, history of laparoscopic appendectomy.
medical_history.family_history: Mother, two sisters, and father have a history of gallbladder disease.
medical_history.social_history: Denies smoking or alcohol use. No history of peptic ulcer disease (PUD). Reports eating a lot of spicy food.
